iPad 3

  • Privacy Policy
 

First Look at the iPad 3

by admin on February 1, 2012 in iPad 3 News with No comments Tweet

If anything is a surefire way to upstart a frenzy in the tech world its a brand new product release from Apple. The next huge mega-release on the calendar is the launch of Apple’s highly anticipated iPad 3.

While there’s still no official word from Apple as to when the actual launch date will happen, experts have begun speculating that the iPad 3 should start hitting store shelves in the second quarter of 2012.

The battle for the tablet computer market grows bigger and bigger ever year. With Apple currently dominating market share with the original iPad as well as the iPad 2 still making money hand over fist. Though other manufacturers are starting to fight back and released some pretty competitive products in the last few months. Samsung is due for a release of the Galaxy Tab this year which is showing some promise and the next generation of Acer Iconia tablets are set to launch around the same time as the Galaxy.

Apple’s iPad 3 release date will therefore have to show some pretty major improvements if Apple expects to hold on to their current market share and Apple fans and critics alike are all eagerly waiting to see what they have in store.

Some Rumored iPad 3 Features:

The ipad 3 is the bestselling tablet on the market thus far. It’s sleek and slender desing plus Apple’s strict adherence to only the best usability features have propelled it into the frontrunner.

  •     Reports suggest that the iPad 3 will offer enhanced screen resolution of an impressive 2048 x 1536. This is twice that of the iPad2 and as yet no other manufacturers have managed to release anything near this onto the market.
  •     The design will also be even thinner and sleeker than previous tablets, down by as much as 20% in overall size.
  •     Full touchscreen HD displays will remain standard with enhanced functionality.
  •     Battery usage has always been an issue with iPads and reports suggest this has been resolved somewhat with the iPad3 with improved battery life and reduced weight.
  •     Battery problems could also be solved with eagerly anticipated wireless charging technology. This would allow the battery to charge without the need to plug the iPad3 into a socket.
  •     The A5 processor in the iPad2 was very powerful, and Apple have gone one step further with the impressive new A6 processor for the iPad3.
  •     This Quad-core processor should make the iPad3 just as powerful as a high-end desktop but with all the convenience of a mobile device. Just another nail in the coffin for traditional desktop computing packages.
  •     It is likely that the latest version of iOS 5 will be installed on the iPad3. Experts also predict, that the powerful OS X Lion could be an alternative installation which would combine well with the new upgraded processor.
  •     This would enable extensive multi-tasking including watching movies, carrying out tasks and managing apps all at the same time.
  •     The Retina Display feature from the iPad 2 is thought to be included in an upgrade for the next generation tablet. This would enable the iPad3 to pack 4 times the number of pixels into the same space making the graphics even crisper and smoother. Hard to believe you could improve so much on the screen resolution, the iPad 2 already features an amazing HD screen!

iPad 3: See You in March

by admin on January 24, 2012 in iPad 3 News with No comments Tweet

Some news reports are suggesting that the release date of Apple’s next generation tablet, the iPad 3, could be well on its way as manufacturing of the iPad 3 has reportedly already begun in Asian factories.

While it might seem like a quick turnaround since the release of the iPad 2, a March 2012 release date for the iPad 3 actually makes sense.

The first generation iPad was released in April of 2010, while the iPad 2 was released just last March. A third spring release would leave many consumers to expect that the iPad 3 would most certainly be due at the end of the first quarter.

iPad 3 Production Begins

industry analysts at Bloomberg say that they believe a new iPad will be released this spring and cite “three people familiar with their product” as their source.

Bloomberg experts speculated further by saying that manufacturing for the new tablet has already begun in Asian factories. Chinese manufacturer, Foxconn, is allegedly running mass production of Apple’s third generation tablet, and have even recently turned their factories over for round the clock production.

New iPad 3 Features

While it’s still pretty early to say for sure what new features the iPad 3 will come equipped with, the Bloomberg report did say that the tablet would incorporate a high-definition screen with “pixels small enough to make the images look like printed material.”

In order to display higher-quality images on this next-generation display, the device would need to be equipped with a quad-core cental processing unit (CPU).

Other reports are suggestion that the new iPad 3 will be a 4G LTE tablet, incorporating much faster wireless broadband technology designed for roaming Internet acccess.

Whereas the iPhone may not be able to handle such a battery drain, Apple remains confident that the 11-hour iPad battery can withstand a 4G LTE incorporation, especially in exchange for a faster Internet connection to better leverage the iCloud.

iPad 3 Release Date Countdown

by admin on January 24, 2012 in iPad 3 News with No comments Tweet

When it comes to rumors surrounding the Apple lineup, believing is almost always seeing. The same saying applies with the latest dose of speculation concerning the list of features that we can expect with Apple’s 2012 release of the iPad 3.

Based on the rumors that have come out thus far, the iPad 3 may see a completely revamped outside design, and when it comes to the features on the inside, things get a little more exciting should the rumors ring true.

There’s been word that the iPad 3 could come equipped with a possible quad-core processor to rival what’s found inside of other tablets such as the Asus Transformer Prime. Improvements on the iPad’s display capabilities have also been mentioned with some analysts saying that the display could be similar to the iPhone’s retina display

Battery quality is said to be a major improvement on the last 2 iPads also. Furthermore, the possibility of 4G LTE support is a pretty real possibility considering the huge list of manufacturers integrating this technology into their own devices.

These are just a few of the rumors circulating around right now, all of which are unconfirmed by Apple. However one thing that we do know for sure is that when the iPad 3 release date hits, we won’t be seeing the iPad 2 being stripped down from store shelves. Apple has officially stated that they’ll be reducing the price of the iPad 2 which could be great news for some consumers who want to get their hands on Apple’s tablet technology without having to spend the money on the iPad 3′s high-end price tag.

Apple iPad 3 Release Date Could Be March

by admin on January 21, 2012 in iPad 3 News with No comments Tweet

A report just released a few days ago by Bloomberg speculates that the iPad 3 release date very well may be coming at the close of the first quarter. The report made mention of Apple’s manufacturing partners in Asia. In addition, the the new iPad 3 is expected to come equipped with a quad-core chip.

The iPad 3 is expected to be Apple’s leading source of revenue this year. And while the iPad 3′s release date will mark the beginning of a critical point for Apple, most analysts are expecting the iPhone 5, which is also said to be 4G friendly, to drive sales even more.

Volume manufacturing is expected to ramp up in February as well says the Report. And if the report is on the money, Apple is likely to see a slowdown in iPad 2 sales, which may already be taking quite the hit what with Amazon’s release of it’s own tablet, the Kindle Fire.

There has also been some speculation that Apple will keep the iPad 2 around in order to hit a few different price points for consumers.

Sharp No Longer Providing iPad 3 Displays

by admin on January 17, 2012 in iPad 3 News with No comments Tweet

Rumors and speculations regarding Sharp no longer manufacturing and providing iPad 3 display screens started to peg early this year. For quite some time, Sharp has been producing and developing the high-density display screens that have been used and equipped on Apple’s iPad 3. However, at present, a new speculation that Sharp wasn’t able to meet the strict specifications and requirements of Apple during the initial operation of displays have began circulating through word and have been flooding the blogs and articles of various sites of the internet. Before you ask about iPad 3 release date, be sure to get your fix of this important iPad 3 news update.

The website known as Patently Apple previously announced a report located on Korean-based website Electronic Times Internet News which points out that Sharp is no longer part of the iPad 3 development project. The display responsibilities for this Apple creation will now fall under the shoulder of two other popular appliance and electronic manufacturing and distributing companies, LG and Samsung Electronics. Former speculations depict that the IGZO technology that Sharp is famous for is set to replace the iPad’s IPS display screen for this new iPad version. Add this to the rumor that is presently circulating, it may suggest that IGZO technology will not at all be integrated into the new iPad 3 after all.

Coming from the Electronic Times Internet News press release, Apple plans on placing an order for more than 65 million display screen units for the year with more than 5 million of those units already being shipped to Foxconn and Pegatron for the expected iPad 3 release date in March.

Continue reading →

iPad 3 GPU Potential

by admin on January 16, 2012 in iPad 3 News with No comments Tweet

With the iPad being the mega-tablet that it is, everyone is wondering about the iPad 3 release date! The original iPad was released in 2010, since then the second generation of the Ipad has also been released. Both Ipads have been succesful and now the big question is when the Ipad 3 will take it’s stand on the market.

On the second generation of the Ipad, the graphics were increased by 9x. Many speculate the designers of the Ipad have increased their graphic size so much in hopes of making the Ipad a stronger gaming platform. Before this can happen many gamers will demand the price of the Ipad 3 to be decreased significantly. Theoretically, the Ipad 3 should then have graphic quality so high that it will be better than all of the competion. Realistically, by the time the Ipad 3 release date comes around, the rival tablet companies may have the technology to do the same.

There is also speculation that the Ipad 3 will be equipped with the A6 chip. Apple has not confirmed this, but many have studied Apple’s release-cycle and the Ipad 3 release date compared with the other release dates show a great chance of the A6 in the Ipad 3. Also, Ipad 3 has a financial stake in Imagination Technologies, so the Ipad 3 release date will also include PowerVR Series6 GPUs.

There is not a certain date for the Ipad 3 release date. There is rumor that the version released in March may be the Ipad 2S, but not the next Ipad. Because the next release date is in March, it is said that the next Ipad release date may actually be later in the year. Regardless, fans will keep up to date with the latest rumors and speculations. Every Ipad fan will want to know about the supposed A6 processors. Every Ipad fan, and gamer, will also be wondering about the fast GPU, maybe even being in competition with the Xbox 360.

There is also talk of the Apple TV working alongside of the next Ipad released. This would create for an even better gaming experience. No one outside of the company knows exactly how Apple would construct this, but this is definitely a possibility that can be done. Even then, many gamers do not think the controls will be able to offer the same gaming experience as the other more traditional gaming platforms.

iPad 3: What to Expect

by admin on January 16, 2012 in iPad 3 News with No comments Tweet

Predictions about the iPad 3 have slowly begun to dissipate, leaving those who dared to predict the birth of its arrival, and the future of the iPad 2 almost in agreement. But regardless of whether the iPad 3 weighs a pound more or a pound less at birth than the iPad 2, or whether it has a quad processor instead of a dual core processor, one thing has been proven, and that is, that the expected iPad 3 release date can be compared to a woman experiencing a pregnacy. The closer the birth, the more excitement it generates.

The Birth of a New Generation – What Do You See?

Standing before a large glass window that isolates newborn babies, there was a huge crowd. The babies were on display, and all of the families who were expecting a new addition stood there admiring new life. So is it with the iPad 3 release date. Spectators on every continent are anxiously awaiting the release to see the technology incorporated in the display.

The display on the iPad 1 and the iPad 2 with its multi-touched, scratchproof and fingerprint- resistant coating, and its one LED bar brought about very few physical changes to the eyes of the person using it. There were no phenomenal changes in the graphics. However, it is suspected that the iPad 3 display will change and Apple will present QXGA, which stands for Quantum Extended Graphics Arrays. This is a 2048 by 1536 pixels display that lets you see the finest details on a screen even it there is a lack of sharpness of the object. This type of display will more than likely need two LED bars, and if the iPad 3 does have this quantum technology built within it, it will be another quantum leap for what you see on tablet computers.This factor alone increases the mounting tension of the iPad 3 release date.

The Heart of the Matter: the Processor

If Apple wants to stay ahead of its competitors and continue to lead the pack, then there will probably be a processor change. Again, we can compare it to growing babies, who suddenly notice that walking on their own two feet get them to the next room much quicker than waiting on someone else to carry them there. If we can assume that this hypothesis is true, then the A6 processor is definitely on its way. If this quad- chip is installed, it will cause pandemonium on the iPad 3-release date. Everyone will be standing in queue for the first iPad 3 tablets with a quad-core chip.
